description: Primes p such that 2p+1 is composite.
comments: Primes not in A005384 = non-Sophie Germain primes.Also, numbers n such that odd part of A005277(n) is prime. Proof by John Renze, Sep 30 2004Sequence gives primes p such that B(2p) has denominator 6, where B(2n) are the Bernoulli numbers. - _Benoit Cloitre_, Feb 06 2002Sequence gives all n such that the equation phi(x)=2n has no solution. - _Benoit Cloitre_, Apr 07 2002A010051(a(n))*(1-A156660(a(n))) = 1; subsequence of A138887. [From _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 18 2009]
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) ~ n log n. [_Charles R Greathouse IV_, Feb 20 2012]
example: 17 is a term because 2*17+1=35 is composite.
mathematica: a={};Do[p=Prime[n];If[ !PrimeQ[2*p+1],AppendTo[a,p]],{n,8^2}];a A115058 Primes p that are also the largest prime factor of p(p^2-1)(3p+2)/24. - _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Apr 29 2008Select[Prime[Range[1000]], ! PrimeQ[2 # + 1] &] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jun 18 2015 *)
prog: (PARI) list(lim)=select(p->!isprime(2*p+1),primes(primepi(lim))) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jul 25 2011(MAGMA) [p: p in PrimesUpTo(12200) | not IsPrime(2*p+1)]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jun 18 2015
author: _Enoch Haga_, Feb 29 2000
